Posted By: Equinox523 (4/29/2009 1:31:58 PM)

posts.post_content:
@DragonKing987
  
   
I can't tell if you're trolling or just didn't quite think through what the card actually does. When it says that nonbasic lands become mountains, it is to an extent saying: "Hey, take that [Tolarian Academy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tolarian Academy), throw it off the table, and then put a [Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain) in its place."
  
   
Now what I said isn't quite right since there are still a number of things like regular types instead of subtypes to worry about, but hopefully this paints a clearer picture for what goes on with this card. For some validation of what I'm saying, here's a link with some Rules Gurus discussing how this card interacts with others while it's on the field:
  
   
http://forums.mtgsalvation.com/showthread.php?t=145245

posts.post_content:
My inner Johnny just looks at this card and screams "[Koth of the Hammer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Koth of the Hammer)!" Run all the nonbasics you want, pump him up a few times, and then play this either for massive extra mana or an instant game-ender. Not the most practical way to run Koth by a long shot, but it would be fun to see your opponent's reaction when you drop this on them.  
  
@TreeTrunkMaster  
"*For one mana more I will take Ruination over this.*"  
  
I'm going to stick my neck out and say that this is a vastly superior card to [Ruination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ruination).  
  
Things that are better about [Ruination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ruination):  
1) Your opponent doesn't get red mana (which may as well be colorless in many decks)  
2) You can search it with [Burning Wish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Wish) if it's in your sideboard  
3) Not vulnerable to enchantment removal  
  
Things that are better about [Blood Moon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood Moon):  
1) 1 less CMC  
2) It's persistent, so you can play it on turn 3 and every nonbasic in play and every one *pla... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)*

posts.post_content: Does this affect ALL non-basic lands, or just those in play? If it affects all, you could use [Perilous Forays](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Perilous Forays) to pull ANY card out of your deck, then [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize) Blood Moon once you've got what you want out.
